title: Chinese Booster and his friends harassing players, but no worry they are not gonna be punished
body:
Hi League of Legends community,
Hi Riot Games, 
When is the developers of League of Legends going to address this issue? What is toxic, unsportsman behaviour? What is cruses? Does it still count if it's in another language? What is abusive behaviour? What is ban-able? Some players can constantly harass other for many games without getting banned, but in some cases, we see people getting banned from one game.

Today, I have been experience worst type of people on League of Legends. And excuse me if I am pissed. In rank, situation can get difficult because each rank game is intense, and rank is a player social status. Therefore, I believe each player will try their best to grind. However, some player are very abusive. They will cruse your entire family if you do not gank their lane. They will wish your mom die from cancer if you don't give them red. Though, we had all experience this time to time. It does not seems like Riot is doing anything to punish these type of player.

The question we must ask. Is this worth to report someone if they shall not be penalised? How effective is the system? If a player cursed another in a different language can it be punishable? What is worst than queuing a rank game, and 4 different player harass you. They called you in names. Ready to intentionally feed. They all chat the other team to report (like the enemy care, but it does have an effect on you).

As a player, encountering this situation can be very frustrating. How can we deal with it? Report does not work. It really does not. Ask yourself, how many time had you reported someone, and they ended up being fine. What's worst, you can be matched with them for many game in a row

League of Legends is a great game. But toxic behaviour has been on a rise. Players have been very spoken about the issue. What is the response from Riot Games, and League of Legends developers?

I shall take my leave here. 

Today, I have been matched with a Chinese booster and his friend, who for 3 games constantly harassed me and other players. In game 3, I response to them and I got banned. Whilst, the player*censored* is still prop harass other players. 
If Riot does not ban toxic players then they are not supporting sportsmanship behaviour. They are encouraging players to be toxic. 
If players figure using other languages beside English shall not be noticed by Riot System, they shall abuse it. 

What is Riot plans to deal with this?

replies.body: Red Flag if you type anything in English. It's recommended by Riot System to use another language
you'll get some coloured names jerk off comment on this saying "the banning system is fine blah blah blah". i'd hate to say it man but you're talking to a brick wall

At the end of the day, it's just a game ey?
to them its just a quick money making business and they don't give a dam about the players.

We could spread the words? If we stop spending RP. Tell your friends what state league is in. They'll stop playing, find another game. Riot'ers are hurt, cause they ain't getting that green bill. We've made an impact, then they changed the system. But until then, say no to RP.
I shall say this again. DON"T BUY RP, WORST POSSIBLE INVESTMENT

Yeah the state of the community is in a pretty bad state. I've already quit playing the game seriously and just go into cybercafes for the odd mess about game. But yeah I'll never buy RP again. I've never been banned, but the quality of games is at its all time low. I don't want to waste 25-45 minutes of my time in a "serious" ranked game just to cop abuse from idiots who make mistakes, trolls who just try to rile up others, and boosters that comment in different languages.

There's other things to do with my time, like doing something **serious**. Not this childish game.

its whoever gets more reports, you are on your own but got reported by multiple people. riot dont care whos worse they just instaban the player with multiple reports without actually bothering to check it.

Number of reports only really matters for edge cases. For normal play one valid report can be enough to see punishment depending on the severity of the offence and/or the consistency of the toxicity.

Reports don't mean anything if they aren't valid.
Even when valid, reports do nothing.
Tell that to the people who get banned I guess?

The ones that are usually chill while the people that ruin it run free on the game?

Yeah, i'll be sure to tell em riot couldnt give 2 craps about em.

Gameplay takes longer to ban because it's harder to be sure it's negative behaviour or just a bad player. Someone could be 0/15 and not be intentionally feeding, hell I had one the other day (think he might have got 1 kill in the end). 

I agree that Gameplay offences should be punished a lot quicker than they are, but does that mean we shouldn't want to punish people who are ruining games with chat in the meantime?
